message: Bills before the Florida Legislature call for giving trafficking victims the right to sue the lodgings where the crime happens — especially those that take no steps to stop an offense some have called modern-day slavery — to cover costs such as medical expenses and mental-health counseling.

data.description: Hotels and motels in Florida and elsewhere have become common sites for a crime some call modern-day slavery, authorities say.
data.title: Bills would let human-trafficking victims sue hotels for damages
